022package com.restfb;
023
024import static com.restfb.logging.RestFBLogger.MAPPER_LOGGER;
025import static com.restfb.util.ObjectUtil.isEmptyCollectionOrMap;
026import static com.restfb.util.ReflectionUtils.*;
027import static com.restfb.util.StringUtils.isBlank;
028import static com.restfb.util.StringUtils.trimToEmpty;
029import static java.lang.String.format;
030import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableList;
031import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableSet;
032
033import java.lang.reflect.Field;
034import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
035import java.lang.reflect.Method;
036import java.math.BigDecimal;
037import java.math.BigInteger;
038import java.util.*;
039import java.util.Map.Entry;
040import java.util.stream.Collectors;
041
042import com.restfb.exception.FacebookJsonMappingException;
043import com.restfb.json.*;
044import com.restfb.types.Comments;
045import com.restfb.util.DateUtils;
046import com.restfb.util.ObjectUtil;
047import com.restfb.util.StringJsonUtils;
048import com.restfb.util.ReflectionUtils.*;
049
050/**
051 * Default implementation of a JSON-to-Java mapper.
052 * 
053 * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
054 */
055public class DefaultJsonMapper implements JsonMapper {
056
057  private FacebookClient facebookClient;
058
059  /**
060   * Helper to convert {@link JsonValue} into a given type
061   */
062  private final JsonHelper jsonHelper;
063
064  /**
065   * Creates a JSON mapper which will throw {@link com.restfb.exception.FacebookJsonMappingException} whenever an error
066   * occurs when mapping JSON data to Java objects.
067   */
068  public DefaultJsonMapper() {
069    jsonHelper = new JsonHelper();
070  }
071
072  @Override
073  public void setFacebookClient(FacebookClient facebookClient) {
074    this.facebookClient = facebookClient;
075  }
076
077  @Override
078  public <T> List<T> toJavaList(String json, Class<T> type) {
079    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(type, () -> new FacebookJsonMappingException("You must specify the Java type to map to."));
080    json = trimToEmpty(json);
081
082    if (isBlank(json)) {
083      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("JSON is an empty string - can't map it.");
084    }
085
086    if (StringJsonUtils.isObject(json)) {
087      // Sometimes Facebook returns the empty object {} when it really should be
088      // returning an empty list [] (example: do an FQL query for a user's
089      // affiliations - it's a list except when there are none, then it turns
090      // into an object). Check for that special case here.
091      if (StringJsonUtils.isEmptyObject(json)) {
092        MAPPER_LOGGER
093          .trace("Encountered \\{} when we should've seen []. Mapping the \\{} as an empty list and moving on...");
094
095        return new ArrayList<>();
096      }
097
098      // Special case: if the only element of this object is an array called
099      // "data", then treat it as a list. The Graph API uses this convention for
100      // connections and in a few other places, e.g. comments on the Post
101      // object.
102      // Doing this simplifies mapping, so we don't have to worry about having a
103      // little placeholder object that only has a "data" value.
104      try {
105        JsonObject jsonObject = Json.parse(json).asObject();
106        List<String> fieldNames = jsonObject.names();
107
108        if (!fieldNames.isEmpty()) {
109          boolean hasSingleDataProperty = fieldNames.size() == 1;
110          Object jsonDataObject = jsonObject.get(fieldNames.get(0));
111
112          if (!hasSingleDataProperty && !(jsonDataObject instanceof JsonArray)) {
113            throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
114              "JSON is an object but is being mapped as a list instead. Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.");
115          }
116
117          json = jsonDataObject.toString();
118        }
119      } catch (ParseException e) {
120        // Should never get here, but just in case...
121        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Unable to convert Facebook response JSON to a list of " + type.getName()
122            + " instances.  Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.",
123          e);
124      }
125    }
126
127    try {
128      JsonArray jsonArray = Json.parse(json).asArray();
129      List<T> list = new ArrayList<>(jsonArray.size());
130      for (JsonValue jsonValue : jsonArray) {
131        String innerJson = jsonHelper.getStringFrom(jsonValue);
132        // the inner JSON starts with square brackets but the parser don't think this is a JSON array
133        // so we think the parser is right and add quotes around the string
134        // solves Issue #719
135        if (jsonValue.isString() && innerJson.startsWith("[")) {
136          innerJson = '"' + innerJson + '"';
137        }
138        list.add(toJavaObject(innerJson, type));
139      }
140      return unmodifiableList(list);
141    } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException e) {
142      throw e;
143    } catch (Exception e) {
144      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
145        "Unable to convert Facebook response JSON to a list of " + type.getName() + " instances", e);
146    }
147  }
148
149  @Override
150  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
151  public <T> T toJavaObject(String json, Class<T> type) {
152    if (StringJsonUtils.isEmptyList(json)) {
153      return toJavaObject(StringJsonUtils.EMPTY_OBJECT, type);
154    }
155
156    basicJsonStringChecks(json);
157
158    try {
159      // Are we asked to map to JsonObject? If so, short-circuit right away.
160      if (type.equals(JsonObject.class)) {
161        return (T) Json.parse(json).asObject();
162      }
163
164      List<FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook>> fieldsWithAnnotation = findFieldsWithAnnotation(type, Facebook.class);
165      Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings = facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings(fieldsWithAnnotation);
166
167      // If there are no annotated fields, assume we're mapping to a built-in
168      // type. If this is actually the empty object, just return a new instance
169      // of the corresponding Java type.
170      if (fieldsWithAnnotation.isEmpty()) {
171        if (StringJsonUtils.isEmptyObject(json)) {
172          T instance = createInstance(type);
173
174          // If there are any methods annotated with @JsonMappingCompleted,
175          // invoke them.
176          invokeJsonMappingCompletedMethods(instance);
177
178          return instance;
179        } else {
180          return toPrimitiveJavaType(json, type);
181        }
182      }
183
184      // Facebook will sometimes return the string "null".
185      // Check for that and bail early if we find it.
186      if (StringJsonUtils.isNull(json)) {
187        return null;
188      }
189
190      // Facebook will sometimes return the string "false" to mean null.
191      // Check for that and bail early if we find it.
192      if (StringJsonUtils.isFalse(json)) {
193        MAPPER_LOGGER.debug("Encountered 'false' from Facebook when trying to map to {} - mapping null instead.",
194          type.getSimpleName());
195        return null;
196      }
197
198      JsonValue jsonValue = Json.parse(json);
199      T instance = createInstance(type);
200
201      if (instance instanceof JsonObject) {
202        return (T) jsonValue.asObject();
203      }
204
205      if (!jsonValue.isObject()) {
206        return null;
207      }
208
209      JsonObject jsonObject = jsonValue.asObject();
210
211      // For each Facebook-annotated field on the current Java object, pull data
212      // out of the JSON object and put it in the Java object
213      for (FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation : fieldsWithAnnotation) {
214        String facebookFieldName = getFacebookFieldName(fieldWithAnnotation);
215
216        if (!jsonObject.contains(facebookFieldName)
217            && !fieldWithAnnotation.getField().getType().equals(Optional.class)) {
218          MAPPER_LOGGER.trace("No JSON value present for '{}', skipping. JSON is '{}'.", facebookFieldName, json);
219          continue;
220        }
221
222        fieldWithAnnotation.getField().setAccessible(true);
223
224        // Set the Java field's value.
225        //
226        // If we notice that this Facebook field name is mapped more than once,
227        // go into a special mode where we swallow any exceptions that occur
228        // when mapping to the Java field. This is because Facebook will
229        // sometimes return data in different formats for the same field name.
230        // See issues 56 and 90 for examples of this behavior and discussion.
231        try {
232          fieldWithAnnotation.getField().set(instance,
233                  toJavaType(fieldWithAnnotation, jsonObject, facebookFieldName));
234        } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException | ParseException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
235          if (facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings.contains(facebookFieldName)) {
236            logMultipleMappingFailedForField(facebookFieldName, fieldWithAnnotation, json);
237          } else {
238            throw e;
239          }
240        }
241      }
242
243      // If there are any methods annotated with @JsonMappingCompleted,
244      // invoke them.
245      invokeJsonMappingCompletedMethods(instance);
246
247      return instance;
248    } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException e) {
249      throw e;
250    } catch (Exception e) {
251      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Unable to map JSON to Java. Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.", e);
252    }
253  }
254
255  private void basicJsonStringChecks(String json) {
256    if (isBlank(json)) {
257      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("JSON is an empty string - can't map it.");
258    }
259
260    if (StringJsonUtils.isList(json)) {
261      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("JSON is an array but is being mapped as an object "
262          + "- you should map it as a List instead. Offending JSON is '" + json + "'.");
263    }
264  }
265
266  /**
267   * Finds and invokes methods on {@code object} that are annotated with the {@code @JsonMappingCompleted} annotation.
268   * <p>
269   * This will even work on {@code private} methods.
270   * 
271   * @param object
272   *          The object on which to invoke the method.
273   * @throws IllegalAccessException
274   *           If unable to invoke the method.
275   * @throws InvocationTargetException
276   *           If unable to invoke the method.
277   */
278  protected void invokeJsonMappingCompletedMethods(Object object)
279      throws IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException {
280    for (Method method : findMethodsWithAnnotation(object.getClass(), JsonMappingCompleted.class)) {
281      method.setAccessible(true);
282
283      if (method.getParameterTypes().length == 0)
284        method.invoke(object);
285      else if (method.getParameterTypes().length == 1 && JsonMapper.class.equals(method.getParameterTypes()[0]))
286        method.invoke(object, this);
287      else
288        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
289          format("Methods annotated with @%s must take 0 parameters or a single %s parameter. Your method was %s",
290            JsonMappingCompleted.class.getSimpleName(), JsonMapper.class.getSimpleName(), method));
291    }
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * Dumps out a log message when one of a multiple-mapped Facebook field name JSON-to-Java mapping operation fails.
296   * 
297   * @param facebookFieldName
298   *          The Facebook field name.
299   * @param fieldWithAnnotation
300   *          The Java field to map to and its annotation.
301   * @param json
302   *          The JSON that failed to map to the Java field.
303   */
304  protected void logMultipleMappingFailedForField(String facebookFieldName,
305      FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation, String json) {
306    if (!MAPPER_LOGGER.isTraceEnabled()) {
307      return;
308    }
309
310    Field field = fieldWithAnnotation.getField();
311
312    MAPPER_LOGGER.trace(
313      "Could not map '{}' to {}. {}, but continuing on because '{}"
314          + "' is mapped to multiple fields in {}. JSON is {}",
315      facebookFieldName, field.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName(), field.getName(), facebookFieldName,
316      field.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName(), json);
317  }
318
319  /**
320   * For a Java field annotated with the {@code Facebook} annotation, figure out what the corresponding Facebook JSON
321   * field name to map to it is.
322   * 
323   * @param fieldWithAnnotation
324   *          A Java field annotated with the {@code Facebook} annotation.
325   * @return The Facebook JSON field name that should be mapped to this Java field.
326   */
327  protected String getFacebookFieldName(FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation) {
328    String facebookFieldName = fieldWithAnnotation.getAnnotation().value();
329    Field field = fieldWithAnnotation.getField();
330
331    // If no Facebook field name was specified in the annotation, assume
332    // it's the same name as the Java field
333    if (isBlank(facebookFieldName)) {
334      MAPPER_LOGGER.trace("No explicit Facebook field name found for {}, so defaulting to the field name itself ({})",
335        field, field.getName());
336
337      facebookFieldName = field.getName();
338    }
339
340    return facebookFieldName;
341  }
342
343  /**
344   * Finds any Facebook JSON fields that are mapped to more than 1 Java field.
345   * 
346   * @param fieldsWithAnnotation
347   *          Java fields annotated with the {@code Facebook} annotation.
348   * @return Any Facebook JSON fields that are mapped to more than 1 Java field.
349   */
350  protected Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings(
351      List<FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook>> fieldsWithAnnotation) {
352    Map<String, Integer> facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount = new HashMap<>();
353
354    // Get a count of Facebook field name occurrences for each
355    // @Facebook-annotated field
356    fieldsWithAnnotation.forEach(field -> {
357      String fieldName = getFacebookFieldName(field);
358      int occurrenceCount = facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount.getOrDefault(fieldName, 0);
359      facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount.put(fieldName, occurrenceCount + 1);
360    });
361
362    // Pull out only those field names with multiple mappings
363    Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings = facebookFieldsNamesWithOccurrenceCount.entrySet().stream()
364      .filter(entry -> entry.getValue() > 1).map(Entry::getKey).collect(Collectors.toSet());
365
366    return unmodifiableSet(facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings);
367  }
368
369  @Override
370  public String toJson(Object object) {
371    return toJson(object, false);
372  }
373
374  @Override
375  public String toJson(Object object, boolean ignoreNullValuedProperties) {
376    JsonValue jsonObj = toJsonInternal(object, ignoreNullValuedProperties);
377    return jsonHelper.getStringFrom(jsonObj);
378  }
379
380  /**
381   * Recursively marshal the given {@code object} to JSON.
382   * <p>
383   * Used by {@link #toJson(Object)}.
384   * 
385   * @param object
386   *          The object to marshal.
387   * @param ignoreNullValuedProperties
388   *          If this is {@code true}, no Javabean properties with {@code null} values will be included in the generated
389   *          JSON.
390   * @return JSON representation of the given {@code object}.
391   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
392   *           If an error occurs while marshaling to JSON.
393   */
394  protected JsonValue toJsonInternal(Object object, boolean ignoreNullValuedProperties) {
395    if (object == null) {
396      return Json.NULL;
397    }
398
399    if (object instanceof JsonValue) {
400      return (JsonValue) object;
401    }
402
403    if (object instanceof List<?>) {
404      JsonArray jsonArray = new JsonArray();
405
406      for (Object o : (List<?>) object)
407        jsonArray.add(toJsonInternal(o, ignoreNullValuedProperties));
408
409      return jsonArray;
410    }
411
412    if (object instanceof Map<?, ?>) {
413      JsonObject jsonObject = new JsonObject();
414      for (Entry<?, ?> entry : ((Map<?, ?>) object).entrySet()) {
415        if (!(entry.getKey() instanceof String)) {
416          throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Your Map keys must be of type " + String.class
417              + " in order to be converted to JSON.  Offending map is " + object);
418        }
419
420        try {
421          jsonObject.add((String) entry.getKey(), toJsonInternal(entry.getValue(), ignoreNullValuedProperties));
422        } catch (ParseException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
423          throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
424            "Unable to process value '" + entry.getValue() + "' for key '" + entry.getKey() + "' in Map " + object, e);
425        }
426      }
427
428      return jsonObject;
429    }
430
431    if (isPrimitive(object)) {
432      return primitiveToJsonValue(object);
433    }
434
435    if (object instanceof Optional) {
436      return toJsonInternal(((Optional) object).orElse(null), ignoreNullValuedProperties);
437    }
438
439    if (object instanceof BigInteger) {
440      return Json.value(((BigInteger) object).longValue());
441    }
442
443    if (object instanceof BigDecimal) {
444      return Json.value(((BigDecimal) object).doubleValue());
445    }
446
447    if (object instanceof Enum) {
448      return Json.value(((Enum) object).name());
449    }
450
451    if (object instanceof Date) {
452      return Json.value(DateUtils.toLongFormatFromDate((Date) object));
453    }
454
455    // We've passed the special-case bits, so let's try to marshal this as a
456    // plain old Javabean...
457
458    List<FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook>> fieldsWithAnnotation =
459        findFieldsWithAnnotation(object.getClass(), Facebook.class);
460
461    JsonObject jsonObject = new JsonObject();
462
463    // No longer throw an exception in this case. If there are multiple fields
464    // with the same @Facebook value, it's luck of the draw which is picked for
465    // JSON marshaling.
466    // TODO: A better implementation would query each duplicate-mapped field. If
467    // it has is a non-null value and the other duplicate values are null, use
468    // the non-null field.
469    Set<String> facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings = facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings(fieldsWithAnnotation);
470    if (!facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings.isEmpty() && MAPPER_LOGGER.isDebugEnabled()) {
471      MAPPER_LOGGER.debug(
472        "Unable to convert to JSON because multiple @{} annotations for the same name are present: {}",
473        Facebook.class.getSimpleName(), facebookFieldNamesWithMultipleMappings);
474    }
475
476    for (FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation : fieldsWithAnnotation) {
477      String facebookFieldName = getFacebookFieldName(fieldWithAnnotation);
478      fieldWithAnnotation.getField().setAccessible(true);
479
480      try {
481        Object fieldValue = fieldWithAnnotation.getField().get(object);
482
483        if (fieldValue instanceof Connection) {
484          continue;
485        }
486
487        if (!(ignoreNullValuedProperties
488            && (fieldValue == null || (fieldValue instanceof Optional && !((Optional) fieldValue).isPresent())
489                || isEmptyCollectionOrMap(fieldValue)))) {
490          jsonObject.add(facebookFieldName, toJsonInternal(fieldValue, ignoreNullValuedProperties));
491        }
492      } catch (Exception e) {
493        throw new FacebookJsonMappingException(
494          "Unable to process field '" + facebookFieldName + "' for " + object.getClass(), e);
495      }
496    }
497
498    return jsonObject;
499  }
500
501  /**
502   * Given a {@code json} value of something like {@code MyValue} or {@code 123} , return a representation of that value
503   * of type {@code type}.
504   * <p>
505   * This is to support non-legal JSON served up by Facebook for API calls like {@code Friends.get} (example result:
506   * {@code [222333,1240079]}).
507   * 
508   * @param <T>
509   *          The Java type to map to.
510   * @param json
511   *          The non-legal JSON to map to the Java type.
512   * @param type
513   *          Type token.
514   * @return Java representation of {@code json}.
515   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
516   *           If an error occurs while mapping JSON to Java.
517   */
518  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
519  protected <T> T toPrimitiveJavaType(String json, Class<T> type) {
520
521    // cleanup the json string
522    json = jsonHelper.cleanString(json);
523
524    if (String.class.equals(type)) {
525      return (T) json;
526    }
527    if (Integer.class.equals(type) || Integer.TYPE.equals(type)) {
528      return (T) Integer.valueOf(json);
529    }
530    if (Boolean.class.equals(type) || Boolean.TYPE.equals(type)) {
531      return (T) Boolean.valueOf(json);
532    }
533    if (Long.class.equals(type) || Long.TYPE.equals(type)) {
534      return (T) Long.valueOf(json);
535    }
536    if (Double.class.equals(type) || Double.TYPE.equals(type)) {
537      return (T) Double.valueOf(json);
538    }
539    if (Float.class.equals(type) || Float.TYPE.equals(type)) {
540      return (T) Float.valueOf(json);
541    }
542    if (BigInteger.class.equals(type)) {
543      return (T) new BigInteger(json);
544    }
545    if (BigDecimal.class.equals(type)) {
546      return (T) new BigDecimal(json);
547    }
548
549    throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Don't know how to map JSON to " + type
550        + ". Are you sure you're mapping to the right class?\nOffending JSON is '" + json + "'.");
551  }
552
553  /**
554   * Extracts JSON data for a field according to its {@code Facebook} annotation and returns it converted to the proper
555   * Java type.
556   * 
557   * @param fieldWithAnnotation
558   *          The field/annotation pair which specifies what Java type to convert to.
559   * @param jsonObject
560   *          "Raw" JSON object to pull data from.
561   * @param facebookFieldName
562   *          Specifies what JSON field to pull "raw" data from.
563   * @return A
564   * @throws ParseException
565   *           If an error occurs while mapping JSON to Java.
566   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
567   *           If an error occurs while mapping JSON to Java.
568   */
569  protected Object toJavaType(FieldWithAnnotation<Facebook> fieldWithAnnotation, JsonObject jsonObject,
570      String facebookFieldName) {
571    Class<?> type = fieldWithAnnotation.getField().getType();
572    JsonValue rawValue = jsonObject.get(facebookFieldName);
573
574    // Short-circuit right off the bat if we've got a null value, but Optionals are created nevertheless.
575    if (rawValue == null || rawValue.isNull()) {
576      if (type.equals(Optional.class)) {
577        return Optional.empty();
578      } else {
579        return null;
580      }
581    }
582
583    if (String.class.equals(type)) {
584      /*
585       * Special handling here for better error checking.
586       *
587       * Since {@code JsonObject.getString()} will return literal JSON text even if it's _not_ a JSON string, we check
588       * the marshaled type and bail if needed. For example, calling {@code JsonObject.getString("results")} on the
589       * below JSON...
590       *
591       * <code> { "results":[ {"name":"Mark Allen"} ] } </code>
592       *
593       * ... would return the string {@code "[{"name":"Mark Allen"}]"} instead of throwing an error. So we throw the
594       * error ourselves.
595       *
596       * Per Antonello Naccarato, sometimes FB will return an empty JSON array instead of an empty string. Look for that
597       * here.
598       */
599      if (rawValue.isArray() && rawValue.asArray().isEmpty()) {
600        MAPPER_LOGGER.trace("Coercing an empty JSON array to an empty string for {}", fieldWithAnnotation);
601
602        return "";
603      }
604
605      /*
606       * If the user wants a string, _always_ give her a string.
607       *
608       * This is useful if, for example, you've got a @Facebook-annotated string field that you'd like to have a numeric
609       * type shoved into.
610       *
611       * User beware: this will turn *anything* into a string, which might lead to results you don't expect.
612       */
613      return jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue);
614    }
615
616    if (Integer.class.equals(type) || Integer.TYPE.equals(type)) {
617      return jsonHelper.getIntegerFrom(rawValue);
618    }
619    if (Boolean.class.equals(type) || Boolean.TYPE.equals(type)) {
620      return jsonHelper.getBooleanFrom(rawValue);
621    }
622    if (Long.class.equals(type) || Long.TYPE.equals(type)) {
623      return jsonHelper.getLongFrom(rawValue);
624    }
625    if (Double.class.equals(type) || Double.TYPE.equals(type)) {
626      return jsonHelper.getDoubleFrom(rawValue);
627    }
628    if (Float.class.equals(type) || Float.TYPE.equals(type)) {
629      return jsonHelper.getFloatFrom(rawValue);
630    }
631    if (BigInteger.class.equals(type)) {
632      return jsonHelper.getBigIntegerFrom(rawValue);
633    }
634    if (BigDecimal.class.equals(type)) {
635      return jsonHelper.getBigDecimalFrom(rawValue);
636    }
637    if (List.class.equals(type)) {
638      return toJavaList(rawValue.toString(), getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(fieldWithAnnotation.getField()));
639    }
640    if (Map.class.equals(type)) {
641      return convertJsonObjectToMap(rawValue.toString(), fieldWithAnnotation.getField());
642    }
643
644    if (Optional.class.equals(type)) {
645      return Optional.ofNullable(
646        toJavaObject(rawValue.toString(), getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(fieldWithAnnotation.getField())));
647    }
648
649    if (type.isEnum()) {
650      Class<? extends Enum> enumType = type.asSubclass(Enum.class);
651      try {
652        return Enum.valueOf(enumType, rawValue.asString());
653      } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
654        MAPPER_LOGGER.debug("Cannot map string {} to enum {}, try fallback toUpperString next...", rawValue.asString(),
655          enumType.getName());
656      }
657      try {
658        return Enum.valueOf(enumType, rawValue.asString().toUpperCase());
659      } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
660        MAPPER_LOGGER.debug("Mapping string {} to enum {} not possible", rawValue.asString(), enumType.getName());
661      }
662    }
663
664    if (Date.class.equals(type)) {
665      return DateUtils.toDateFromLongFormat(jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue));
666    }
667
668    if (Connection.class.equals(type)) {
669      if (null != facebookClient) {
670        return new Connection(facebookClient, jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue),
671          getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(fieldWithAnnotation.getField()));
672      } else {
673        MAPPER_LOGGER.warn(
674          "Skipping java field {}, because it has the type Connection, but the given facebook client is null",
675          fieldWithAnnotation.getField().getName());
676      }
677    }
678
679    String rawValueAsString = jsonHelper.getStringFrom(rawValue);
680
681    // Hack for issue #76 where FB will sometimes return a Post's Comments as
682    // "[]" instead of an object type (wtf)F
683    if (Comments.class.isAssignableFrom(type) && rawValue instanceof JsonArray) {
684      MAPPER_LOGGER.debug(
685        "Encountered comment array '{}' but expected a {} object instead.  Working around that by coercing "
686            + "into an empty {} instance...",
687        rawValueAsString, Comments.class.getSimpleName(), Comments.class.getSimpleName());
688
689      JsonObject workaroundJsonObject = new JsonObject();
690      workaroundJsonObject.add("total_count", 0);
691      workaroundJsonObject.add("data", new JsonArray());
692      rawValueAsString = workaroundJsonObject.toString();
693    }
694
695    // Some other type - recurse into it
696    return toJavaObject(rawValueAsString, type);
697  }
698
699  private Map convertJsonObjectToMap(String json, Field field) {
700    Class<?> firstParam = getFirstParameterizedTypeArgument(field);
701    if (!String.class.equals(firstParam)) {
702      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("The java type map needs to have a 'String' key, but is " + firstParam);
703    }
704
705    Class<?> secondParam = getSecondParameterizedTypeArgument(field);
706
707    if (StringJsonUtils.isObject(json)) {
708      JsonObject jsonObject = Json.parse(json).asObject();
709      Map<String, Object> map = new HashMap<>();
710      for (String key : jsonObject.names()) {
711        String value = jsonHelper.getStringFrom(jsonObject.get(key));
712        map.put(key, toJavaObject(value, secondParam));
713      }
714      return map;
715    }
716
717    return null;
718  }
719
720  private JsonValue primitiveToJsonValue(Object object) {
721    if (object == null) {
722      return Json.NULL;
723    }
724
725    Class<?> type = object.getClass();
726
727    if (object instanceof String) {
728      return Json.value((String) object);
729    }
730
731    if (object instanceof Integer || Integer.TYPE.equals(type)) {
732      return Json.value((Integer) object);
733    }
734
735    if (object instanceof Boolean || Boolean.TYPE.equals(type)) {
736      return Json.value((Boolean) object);
737    }
738
739    if (object instanceof Long || Long.TYPE.equals(type)) {
740      return Json.value((Long) object);
741    }
742
743    if (object instanceof Double || Double.TYPE.equals(type)) {
744      return Json.value((Double) object);
745    }
746
747    if (object instanceof Float || Float.TYPE.equals(type)) {
748      return Json.value((Float) object);
749    }
750
751    if (object instanceof Byte || Byte.TYPE.equals(type)) {
752      return Json.value((Byte) object);
753    }
754    if (object instanceof Short || Short.TYPE.equals(type)) {
755      return Json.value((Short) object);
756    }
757
758    if (object instanceof Character || Character.TYPE.equals(type)) {
759      return Json.value(Character.toString((Character) object));
760    }
761
762    return Json.NULL;
763
764  }
765}
